intro: Trichoon paniceus, commonly known as the panicled trichoon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in paniculate inflorescences, giving it a delicate, feathery appearance. Trichoon paniceus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
